Following a pilot study in Italy and Spain, analysis of carriers (n = 11,609) collected through 24 study groups participating in the Consortium of Investigators of Modifiers of BRCA1/2 (CIMBA) detected significant modification of breast cancer risk by HMMR rs299290 variant among BRCA1, but not BRCA2, mutation carriers: BRCA1 mutation carriers n = 7,584, Cox proportional-hazards regression model, hazard ratio (HR) = 1.08 (95% confidence interval (CI) 1.02-1.13), ptrend = 0.004 (p 2df = 0.014), in the same direction as originally detected in Ashkenazi Jewish populations; BRCA2 mutation carriers n = 3,965, HR = 1.03 (95% CI 0.96-1.10), ptrend = 0.42 (p 2df = 0.67)
Effect of HMMR rs299290 variation on breast cancer risk among BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutation carriers.
